quickView.definicao: Primary recurrent headache, characterized by episodes of pulsating pain, usually unilateral, of moderate to severe intensity, associated with nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. It may be preceded by an aura.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ≥2: unilateral, pulsating, moderate/severe, worsened by physical activity
AURA: Fully reversible visual, sensory, or speech symptoms (5-60 minutes)

naoFarmacologico: Identify and avoid triggers (stress, fasting, sleep deprivation, alcohol)
farmacologico: Simple analgesics: Paracetamol 1g or Dipirona 1g (mild attacks)

metasTerapeuticas: Reduction in intensity and duration of attacks
examesIniciais: Neuroimaging (CT/MRI) if: onset >50 years, atypical headache, focal neurological signs, change in pattern, thunderclap headache
redFlags: Worst headache of life or thunderclap (SAH)

fisiopatologia.texto: Involves activation of the trigeminovascular system, with release of vasoactive neuropeptides (CGRP) and neurogenic inflammation. Cortical spreading depression explains the aura. Central sensitization contributes to chronicity.

sinaisExameFisico: May have cutaneous allodynia during attack

examesLaboratoriais: Complete blood count, ESR if temporal arteritis is suspected
Lumbar puncture if SAH or meningitis is suspected

primeiraLinha.posologia: Ibuprofen 400-600mg or Naproxen 500mg. Early in the attack.

segundaLinha.posologia: Amitriptyline 25-75mg at night. Good if insomnia or depression.

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Botulinum toxin type A. Anti-CGRP antibodies (erenumab, fremanezumab).
Paracetamol as analgesic. Propranolol can be used as prophylaxis. Avoid ergotamines and NSAIDs in the 3rd trimester.

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Monthly until control, then every 3-6 months

quickView.definicao: Primary headache characterized by a pressing/tightening quality, bilateral, mild to moderate intensity, not aggravated by physical activity.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ≥2: bilateral, pressing/tightening quality, mild-moderate intensity, not aggravated by physical activity
redFlags: Sudden and severe headache onset (subarachnoid hemorrhage)
Headache with fever and neck stiffness (meningitis)

quickView.definicao: Focal neurological deficit of sudden onset caused by cerebral ischemia (arterial occlusion due to thrombosis or embolism). Medical emergency - "time is brain". Treatable with thrombolysis if <4.5h from onset.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Focal neurological deficit of sudden onset:
Non-contrast CT scan of the head: excludes hemorrhage, may show early signs of ischemia

naoFarmacologico: Do not aggressively lower BP (except if >220/120)
farmacologico: IV THROMBOLYSIS (if <4.5h from onset and no CI):
MECHANICAL THROMBECTOMY: up to 24h in selected cases (large vessel occlusion)
Anticoagulation if AF (after 2-14 days): Apixaban, Rivaroxaban

examesIniciais: Non-contrast CT scan of the head (IMMEDIATELY)
Complete blood count, electrolytes, renal function
CT angiography if candidate for thrombectomy
redFlags: THESE ARE THE RED FLAGS - STROKE IS ALWAYS AN EMERGENCY
Any sudden neurological deficit = stroke until proven otherwise

epidemiologia.prevalencia: 2-3% of the population has had a stroke
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Increases with age, but can occur in young individuals

fisiopatologia.texto: Arterial occlusion (thrombotic or embolic) causes ischemia in the affected territory. The ischemic core rapidly undergoes necrosis. The ischemic penumbra is potentially salvageable with early reperfusion. Ischemic cascade with excitotoxicity, inflammation, and apoptosis.

formasClinicas: TIA: deficit <24h (usually minutes), no lesion on imaging

criterios: MRI (diffusion): more sensitive for early ischemia
examesLaboratoriais: Complete blood count, coagulation, renal function

primeiraLinha.posologia: Aspirin 100-300mg/day. If no thrombolysis: start at 24-48h.

segundaLinha.posologia: Start after 2-14 days (depending on stroke size). Apixaban 5mg 12/12h.

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Mechanical thrombectomy up to 24h (selected by imaging).
Control BP, reverse anticoagulation, neurosurgery if indicated.

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Monthly for the first 3 months, then quarterly

quickView.definicao: A brain disorder characterized by a persistent predisposition to generate epileptic seizures and the neurobiological, cognitive, psychological, and social consequences. Diagnosis: ≥2 unprovoked seizures with an interval >24h, or 1 seizure + recurrence risk >60%.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ≥2 unprovoked (or reflex) seizures with an interval >24h, OR
1 unprovoked seizure + probability of recurrence ≥60% (e.g., structural lesion, epileptiform EEG), OR

naoFarmacologico: Safety measures (open bathroom door, no swimming alone)
farmacologico: GENERALIZED SEIZURES: Valproate 500-2000mg/day (caution in women) or Lamotrigine
Start with low dose, titrate slowly

examesIniciais: Basic laboratory tests (electrolytes, glucose, liver/kidney function)
redFlags: Status epilepticus (seizure >5 min or consecutive seizures)
First seizure in an adult (investigate cause)

fisiopatologia.texto: Excessive and hypersynchronized neuronal discharges resulting from an imbalance between excitation (glutamate) and inhibition (GABA). It can originate from a cortical focus (focal) or involve both hemispheres from the start (generalized).

sintomasPrincipais: Focal seizures: aura, automatisms, altered consciousness
Generalized tonic-clonic seizures: loss of consciousness, rigidity, convulsions
Absences: brief loss of consciousness, vacant stare
sinaisExameFisico: Focal deficits may be present (structural lesion)
Lateral tongue bite (suggestive of generalized tonic-clonic seizure)

criterios: EEG (may be normal in up to 50% on first test)

primeiraLinha.posologia: Valproate 500-2000mg/day. Avoid in women of childbearing age (teratogenic).

segundaLinha.posologia: Add or switch based on response. Rational polytherapy.

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Diazepam 10mg IV or Midazolam 10mg IM. If refractory: Phenytoin/Fosphenytoin IV.
Avoid Valproate. Prefer Lamotrigine or Levetiracetam. Supplement folic acid.

tratamento.duracao: Generally for years. Consider discontinuation after 2-5 years without seizures (selected cases).

quickView.definicao: Neurodegenerative disease. Loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra. Tremor, rigidity, bradykinesia.

classificacaoEspecifica.descricao: Focal epilepsy with or without secondary generalization

quickView.definicao: Epilepsy characterized by seizures that originate in a focal region of the cerebral cortex, which may remain focal or generalize secondarily.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ≥2 unprovoked seizures with an interval >24 hours
Focal symptoms: motor (facial muscles, arm/leg), sensory, autonomic, psychic
MRI: may show structural lesion (scar, tumor, malformation)

naoFarmacologico: Evaluate for surgical indication if resistant

examesIniciais: MRI of the brain with special sequences
Complete blood count, liver function, kidney function

escalasNeurologicas.name: Epilepsy Severity Scale
escalasNeurologicas.description: Evaluates frequency and type of seizures

cirurgia.indicacao: Focal epilepsy resistant to ≥2 adequate medications
cirurgia.tipo: Surgical resection of the epileptic focus

prognostico.expectativa: Control with medication in 60-70% of cases

quickView.definicao: Epilepsia caracterizada por crises que se originam simultaneamente em ambos os hemisférios cerebrais, sem início focal.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ≥2 crises epilépticas não provocadas com intervalo >24 horas
Crises generalizadas: tônica-clônica, ausências, mioclônicas, tônicas, atônicas
Ausência de foco focal no EEG

examesNeurologicos.indicacao: Confirmar diagnóstico e tipo de crise

prognostico.expectativa: Controle com medicação em 70-80% dos casos

quickView.definicao: Severe primary headache, unilateral, periorbital/temporal, lasting 15-180 minutes, associated with autonomic symptoms (lacrimation, rhinorrhoea, ptosis).
criteriosDiagnosticos: Unilateral pain, periorbital/temporal, severe or very severe
≥1 ipsilateral symptom: lacrimation, congestion/rhinorrhoea, facial sweating, miosis/ptosis, eyelid oedema
Frequency: from every other day to 8/day

naoFarmacologico: Inhalation oxygen therapy (100% O2, 7-15L/min for 15 minutes)
farmacologico: Acute attack: Sumatriptan 6mg SC or 20mg intranasal

quickView.definicao: Peripheral neuropathy associated with diabetes mellitus, characterized by sensory symptoms (pain, burning, tingling) and/or motor deficits, typically in a "glove and stocking" pattern.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Symptoms: pain, burning, tingling, numbness in feet/hands
Physical examination: decreased sensitivity (vibration, fine touch), diminished reflexes

quickView.definicao: Compression of the median nerve in the carpal tunnel. Often related to repetitive activities.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Paresthesia in the first three fingers

quickView.definicao: A demyelinating disease of the CNS. Disseminated lesions in time and space.

farmacologico: Interferon beta or Fingolimod to reduce relapses

classificacaoEspecifica.descricao: Doença de Huntington - Doença neurodegenerativa autossômica dominante

quickView.definicao: Doença neurodegenerativa autossômica dominante caracterizada por coreia (movimentos involuntários), deterioração cognitiva e distúrbios psiquiátricos, causada por expansão de repetições CAG no gene HTT.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Teste genético: expansão CAG ≥36 repetições no gene HTT
examesIniciais: RM de crânio (atrofia de núcleo caudado)

prognostico.expectativa: Progressão inexorável, sobrevida 15-20 anos após início

quickView.definicao: A fatal neurodegenerative disease characterized by progressive degeneration of upper and lower motor neurons, resulting in progressive muscle weakness, atrophy, and eventually respiratory paralysis.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Evidence of upper motor neuron degeneration (spasticity, hyperreflexia)
Evidence of lower motor neuron degeneration (atrophy, fasciculations, weakness)

farmacologico: Riluzole 50mg twice daily (extends survival by 2-3 months)

examesIniciais: MRI of brain and spinal cord

quickView.definicao: A demyelinating disease of the central nervous system characterized by bilateral optic neuritis and extensive transverse myelitis, associated with anti-aquaporin-4 (AQP4) antibodies.
criteriosDiagnosticos: - Brain MRI does not meet MS criteria

farmacologico: Acute relapse: Methylprednisolone 1g/day IV for 3-5 days

examesIniciais: CSF (oligoclonal bands less frequent than in MS)

examesNeurologicos.indicacao: To assess the extent of myelitis

prognostico.expectativa: Variable, can be severe with frequent relapses

quickView.definicao: An autoimmune neuromuscular junction disorder characterized by muscle weakness and fatigue that worsens with activity and improves with rest, caused by antibodies against acetylcholine receptors.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Worsens with activity, improves with rest
Typical pattern: ptosis, diplopia, facial/bulbar/proximal weakness
EMG: decremental response to repetitive stimulation

farmacologico: Myasthenic crisis: IV Immunoglobulin or Plasmapheresis

prognostico.expectativa: Good control with treatment, but requires monitoring

quickView.definicao: A rare subtype of migraine with aura characterized by motor weakness (hemiparesis) during the aura, which can last from minutes to days.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ICHD-3 criteria for migraine with aura
Unilateral motor weakness in the aura

farmacologico: Avoid triptans and ergotamine (risk of stroke)

quickView.definicao: Acute neuropsychiatric syndrome with attention and consciousness impairment of fluctuating course. Affects 10-30% of hospitalized elderly.
Syndrome of progressive cognitive decline with functional impairment. Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause (60-70%). Prevalence doubles every 5 years after age 65.
The most common cause of vertigo. Displacement of otoconia into the semicircular canals. Brief episodes (<1min) triggered by head movements.

farmacologico: Meclizine for transient symptomatic relief only

quickView.definicao: Lesion of peripheral nerves. Symptoms: paresthesia, tingling, burning, weakness, pain. Causes: diabetes, nutritional deficiencies, toxins.

farmacologico: Supplementation: B12, B6, Folic acid if deficient

quickView.definicao: Acute demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy. Usually post-infectious. Ascending paralysis.
Dementia due to cerebral vascular lesions. Can be ischemic or hemorrhagic. Multifocal cognitive decline.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Temporal relationship between vascular event and dementia

quickView.definicao: Peripheral vertigo. Inflammation of the labyrinth. Causes: viral, bacterial, BPPV. Rotational vertigo with nausea/vomiting.

Focal neurological deficit of sudden onset caused by cerebral ischemia. Neurological emergency with critical therapeutic window for thrombolysis (4.5h) and mechanical thrombectomy (up to 24h in selected cases).
criteriosDiagnosticos: Focal neurological deficit of sudden onset
FAST: Face (asymmetry), Arm (weakness), Speech (speech alteration), Time
Non-contrast CT of the head: excludes hemorrhage (may be normal in the first few hours)
Time of symptom onset is critical

naoFarmacologico: Head of bed at 0° (no intracranial hypertension)
farmacologico: DO NOT REDUCE BP IF <220/120 (thrombolysis candidate: <185/110)

examesIniciais: Non-contrast CT of the head (excludes hemorrhage)
redFlags: Severe IS/TBI in the past 3 months
Major surgery in the past 14 days

epidemiologia.prevalencia: 2nd leading cause of death in Brazil
epidemiologia.mortalidade: 30% mortality at 30 days, leading cause of disability
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Increases with age, >55 years higher risk

fisiopatologia.texto: Arterial occlusion by thrombus (cardioembolic, atherothrombotic, or lacunar) leading to cerebral ischemia. There is a penumbra area potentially salvageable around the ischemic core. The therapeutic window aims to save this penumbra.

criterios: Exclusion of mimics (hypoglycemia, post-ictal epileptic seizure)
examesImagem: Angio-CT of cervical and intracranial vessels

segundaLinha.observacoes: If AF, after 3-14 days depending on IS size

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Discharge from stroke unit in 5-7 days, then monthly for 3 months
metasTerapeuticas: LDL <70 mg/dL (or <55 if very high risk)
criteriosEncaminhamento: Young without risk factors: Investigation of thrombophilias

quickView.definicao: Continuous epileptic activity for >5 minutes or recurrent seizures without recovery of consciousness between them. A neurological emergency with a risk of permanent brain damage and death if not treated promptly.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Two or more seizures without recovery of consciousness
Non-convulsive status epilepticus: altered consciousness + epileptiform activity on EEG

naoFarmacologico: ABC - airway with oropharyngeal airway (do not force)
farmacologico: Midazolam 10mg IM (if no venous access) OR
Anesthetic induction: Propofol, Midazolam, or Thiopental in BIC

examesIniciais: Complete blood count, electrolytes (Na, K, Ca, Mg)
Lumbar puncture (if infection is suspected, after imaging)
redFlags: Refractory status epilepticus (no response to 2 AEDs)

epidemiologia.incidencia: Mortality of 20-30% in refractory status epilepticus
fatoresRisco: Previous epilepsy (poor adherence, reduction of AEDs)

fisiopatologia.texto: Failure of inhibitory mechanisms (GABAergic) to terminate ictal activity, with sustained excitatory hyperactivity (glutamatergic). This leads to excitotoxicity, neuronal damage, cerebral edema, and potential respiratory/cardiovascular failure.

formasClinicas: Focal status epilepticus with preserved consciousness
Focal status epilepticus with impaired consciousness
Non-convulsive status epilepticus (suspect in prolonged altered consciousness)
Subtle status epilepticus (minimal movements, epileptiform EEG)

criterios: Temporal criterion: ≥5 minutes of seizure or recurrent seizures without recovery
examesImagem: Head MRI (if CT is normal and cause is not identified)
outrosExames: Lumbar puncture (if neuroinfection is suspected, after imaging)

primeiraLinha.posologia: Single dose, repeat once if necessary

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Anesthetics: Midazolam, Propofol, or Thiopental in BIC; intubation + mechanical ventilation; continuous EEG

tratamento.duracao: Maintenance with AED according to etiology

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: ICU until control; then outpatient neurology
